alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Florence and southeastern Darlington Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Darlington Raceway, or near Darlington, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Darlington, Timmonsville, Lamar, Quinby, Oats, Darlington Raceway, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Lydia, Mcleod Regional Medical Center, Carolinas Hospital System - Cedar Tower and Health South Rehabilitation Hospital. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 126 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina near mile marker 146, and between mile markers 156 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
